skills.skill: SAP EWM Standard handheld scanning transactions
Barcode label development using GTIN, UPC-A, GS1
S4 HANA Master and Transaction Data
Unit tests, Integration tests, and Regression tests
Pharma guidelines including GAMP, 21 CFR Part 11

duties_responsibilities.duty: Design, configure, test, and implement SAP logistics solutions, with a focus on SAP EWM Standard handheld scanning transactions.
Collaborate with the Supply Chain Team, SAP Development, and 3rd party service providers to execute SAP Logistics & Barcoding functional activities.
Maintain documentation, assess emerging SAP technologies, and interpret business value for the IT management.
Develop productive relationships with business across the organization to influence how SAP Logistics and Barcoding applications can enable new sources of value.
Conduct workshops, testing, and client training for SAP solutions.
Ensure compliance with regulatory requirements and maintain good development and documentation practices.
Evaluate and shift priorities based on changing demands and assist in training and knowledge sharing.

education_certification.credential: Bachelor's degree in Information Technology, Computer Science, or a related field (Master's preferred)
